## Entity.startModelOneshotAnimations() method

Starts a oneshot animation for the entity, blending with other animations currently playing.

**Signature:**

```typescript
startModelOneshotAnimations(animations: string[]): void;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

animations


</td><td>

string\[\]


</td><td>

The animations to start.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

void

## Remarks

\*\*No deduplication:\*\* Unlike `startModelLoopedAnimations`<!-- -->, this always emits the event even if the animation is already playing. This allows restarting oneshot animations.

\*\*Tracking:\*\* Oneshot animations are tracked internally to prevent packet spam from `stopModelAnimations()` but are not serialized for new player joins (they're transient).
